Module kivakit.validation
Package com.telenav.kivakit.validation

Interface Validator

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseValidator, NullValidator
public interface Validator
When validate(Listener) is called, a Validator validates itself, using the listener parameter to send messages like Problem s and Warnings as validation proceeds. If no failure Message is sent the method returns true, allowing the caller to make success or failure decisions easily. The BaseValidator class makes it easy to implement validators by hiding access to the listener and providing methods that check conditions and broadcast messages.

Factory Methods

  • nullValidator()

Validation

  • validate(Listener)

  • Method Details

    • nullValidator

      static Validator nullValidator()
      A validator that does nothing

    • validate

      boolean validate(Listener listener)
      Validates this object, transmitting issues to the given listener. The listener ValidationIssues is handy for capturing validation messages.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to transmit problems and warnings to. Note that Listener has convenience methods on it to make composing and sending the messages easier.
      Returns:
      True if the object being validated is valid
      See Also:
      • Listener
      • Validatable
      • ValidationIssues
